docs.snippet: LEAD:  International A3-19  A panel has uncovered new data linking the National Security Council to private efforts aiding the Nicaraguan rebels at a time when such activity by the Government was illegal, according to informants. Page A1  Prospect...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: International A3-19 A panel has uncovered new data linking the National Security Council to private efforts aiding the Nicaraguan rebels at a time when such activity by the Government was illegal, according to informants. Page A1 Prospects for new Congressional aid to the Nicaraguan insurgents are so bleak that the Reagan Administration may postpone its formal request until September, Administration officials said.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Opponents say he isn't that fast and that he isn't that quick. But Mark Jackson, who is on the way to one of the most remarkable seasons in recent St. John's history, is proving that he is fast enough and quick enough for any competition he ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Opponents say he isn't that fast and that he isn't that quick. But Mark Jackson, who is on the way to one of the most remarkable seasons in recent St. John's history, is proving that he is fast enough and quick enough for any competition he is likely to meet this season.

byline.original: By WILLIAM C. RHODEN, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: DONALD WATTS still shaves his head, and wears a thick headband on the court, making him look like the planet Saturn in sneakers. At the Dunlap Elementary School in Seattle, his name is Mr. Watts, but yesterday, for a few hours, he was Slick Watts again.

docs.snippet: LEAD: AT the Gettysburg cemetery, the Abraham Lincoln of Gore Vidal's novel barely gets through his first sentence - about the events in America ''four score and seven years ago'' - when the young Presidential secretary, John Hay, cynically observ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: AT the Gettysburg cemetery, the Abraham Lincoln of Gore Vidal's novel barely gets through his first sentence - about the events in America ''four score and seven years ago'' - when the young Presidential secretary, John Hay, cynically observes that such rhetoric ''will please the radicals.'' Though the national commitment to the noble notion that ''all men are created equal,'' particularly in its Civil War, black-white context, is thereby dismissed, the Gettysburg Ad-dress itself is not.

byline.original: By Gabor S. Boritt; Gabor S. Boritt is the first Robert C. Fluhrer Distinguished Professor of Civil War Studies at Gettysburg College

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Royal Philharmonic, like all the major British orchestras, is supported by private sponsors and government grants. But when it comes to records, the RPO, like the others, has had to fend for itself, dealing with commercial record compani...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Royal Philharmonic, like all the major British orchestras, is supported by private sponsors and government grants. But when it comes to records, the RPO, like the others, has had to fend for itself, dealing with commercial record companies on a commercial basis. Recently, however, the Royal Philharmonic decided it wanted to be able to call the tune, so to speak, on recordings, and formed its own record company, called, of course, RPO Records.
